reviews.review: ta weno

before i played this game, i thought it was honestly gonna be overrated y'know? like "psshhh i mean, i bet it would be good but not that good.. i mean it can't be the most perfect game ever like everyone says right?" but when i played it my eyes were opened... sure, i beat the game in 3 days and normal difficulty is pretty easy and sometimes the physics can be... rather annoying.. BUT i will say this game blew me out of the water, the at direction i thought was amazing and the enemies felt like nothing i've experienced before.. maybe it's because im more of an open world kind of guy yknow?

but here's a better review: Half Life 2 is a well designed and well directed first person shooter which allows and even encourages you to be creative in order to fully enjoy the presentation laid out before you. In another game like Doom or Cod you'd be either constantly running around and shooting enemies or hiding in cover to wait for your regenerating health, sometimes do a simple flank or do dodge. In Half Life 2 you use your bug bait to make antlions a distraction for your enemies and use your grav gun to create makeshift cover to try and throw a grenade at your enemies. The levels are huge and well designed and i never felt like i would get lost inside them, i somehow felt like the game easily showed me where to go without waypoints or a minimap, not to mention each level tells you to as said before) use the systems laid out for you and situations presented to you to complete several tasks.

on story and art design: even though the textures can look..well.. dated.. it's still a really beautiful game due to it's art direction and level design, the aesthetic of the combine arsenal somehow feels alien yet human at the same time, City 17 feels like im in some crappy soviet apartment and the final chapters made me feel like i was really in a war zone. the designs of the combine and enemy behavior are also well made, with most (most) enemies feeling and looking unique, and Combine tech feels less like it's made of steel but more like some kind of fungal like metal.

anyway, in conclusion:

the gameplay is very fun, and on normal difficulty it's actually pretty easy, but easy in a challengy way. The graphics are still good and the story is also great, go buy it... 10/10
I approve
Certified hood classic

Finally finished Half Life 2. It's a fairly difficult game but insanely fun. I can't believe how the the ending hits you like a bus.
I don't really mind the very dated graphics, it's gameplay and story more than make up for it. I almost started clapping after the end credits appeared. Portal 1 and 2 were amazing, but Half Life is somehow better, even though Portal "looks" better. 10/10 highly recommend! I now understand why everyone loves Valve so much. This is truly a gaming work of art!
Just... wow! I love Valve!!!
игра хоть и не самая свежая, но очень классная!

Ну блин, это же игра легенда, конечно же она заслуживает лайка. По сюжету реально круто, графон остался в 2004 году, но после покупки этой игры в стиме, вы сможете бесплатно сказать мод для Half-Life 2 название которого Half-Life 2 Update. Этот мод весит вроде 14 гб и меняет механику игры, графику и некоторые модели, причём ни сюжет, ни любимых персонажей он не трогает. Качество картинки и моделей улучшилось в 4 раза. Если вы настоящий фанат Халвы, то вы сразу заметите разницу.

Took me way too long to finally get into this series, but its damn good. I skipped HL1 because I already watched a playthrough and jumped right into the second, and its a damn blast. I shouldn't be so surprised that so many mechanics are used well in the game, but it kept me on my toes the entire time. As of writing this, I'm nowhere near halfway done with it either, and with how dense I am when it comes to puzzles, I expect my playtime to double before I'm done. But the fact I get to enjoy every second of it makes it a worthwhile game for me. I think the only downside I can think of so far is I experienced a map loading glitch early-game which forced me to actually noclip to get by, but otherwise everything works as it should.

Half Life 2 is the sequel to Half Life developed by Valve. The game is a FPS, but the gunplay in 2020 is rather tame. Weapons do not have a lot of recoil and shooting feels too easy. Thankfully, about a third of the way through, you are given the gravity gun. The gravity gun turns almost any object into a physics based weapon and allows for a much more varied combat flow. There's even an achievement for completing a level with only the gravity gun. The game is set 20 or so years after Half Life 1 and features a world taken over by the Combine, an interdimensional alien empire. Humanity surrendered to the Combine not long after they invaded. You play as Gordon Freeman and aid the resistance to free Earth. The game has a hyperspace arsenal allowing you to carry and swap between multiple weapons at a time. It also features two vehicle heavy sections using a car and an airboat. I prefer the car. You visit a variety of locales including abandoned towns, prisons, coastal villages, cities, and the Combine Citadel which serves as their HQ. A complete casual playthrough can last about 8-10 hours.

Weapons include a crowbar, SMG, pistol, magnum, shotgun, grenades, RPG, and an AR. A crossbow can be used for sniping. Music is subtle and fitting for the sections it is used for. 

It's probably Valve's trademark game and you are on Steam. Give it a shot.

The best Half Life game I played next to Alyx.

I enjoyed this game, though I felt 1 was superior in it's pacing. I felt the emphasis on puzzles was better done in 1 where you had to take the game a little slower to survive and so you gained much more nostalgia. I loved Ravenholm, and had some heavy laughs trying to drive things. I LOVED the sand antlion babies that you could get :O. They were so cool, was so upset when they went away lol. I liked the new storyline :).
I recommend you play Half-Life 1 first because then when you play Half-Life 2 you get the story line

I stopped playing because of the damn car. I kept trying to get out of it because I hated it so much, any time I'd come to an area, and it wasn't blaringly obvious where I was supposed to drive, I just got out. I'd walk a ways, then come to that same grim realization... More car. 

Eventually, I was in such deep hatred that my brain had forced itself into a state of denial that allowed me to walk for at least 20 minutes along a clearly car-oriented highway without realizing that I should probably go back and get the damn car. When I finally realized what I'd done, the game had somehow saved over the event such that I'd either have to walk another 20 minutes, or re-do a seemingly ridiculous amount of the game, so I just stopped. 

Stupid fuckin car.
